thread.title: Vietnamese team protest dodgy penalty… by standing still for rest of game and letting opposition score twice
thread.title_full: Vietnamese team protest dodgy penalty… by standing still for rest of game and letting opposition score twice

author: Jake Polden
title: Vietnamese team protest dodgy penalty… by standing still for rest of game and letting opposition score twice
text:
Sport Vietnamese team protest dodgy penalty… by standing still for rest of game and letting opposition score twice Particularly impressive: the way the goalkeeper acrobatically rolled out the way of an attacker to allow him to score in the V-League clash Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Vietnamese team refuse to continue playing after penalty decision Share this video     
As bizarre moments on a football pitch go, this is well up there. 
During Ho Chi Minh City's 5-2 win over Long An, the referee awarded a late penalty to the home side. And, well, the Long An players weren't impressed. 
Now most teams surround the referee, voice their frustration, say a few choice things and, finally, get on with the game - maybe on a booking - when they're in a similar situation. 
But as the above video shows, this particular V-League side deal with things a little differently. Don't turn your back on me! 
After conceding a spot-kick, the opposition team simply go on protest. 
It's a relatively bizarre tactic and does them absolutely no favours whatsoever, but the match footage is pretty hilarious as a result. 
After coaxing the goalkeeper back in between the sticks - which takes some time - the referee blows his whistle and watches in shock as he turns his back on the penalty-taker. This is surprisingly easy What. On. Earth 
The striker of course hits the back of the net and heads to the centre circle for kick-off, before his side run the full length of the pitch to score another. 
The Ho Chi Minh City player is able to do so because every single member of the opposition team is still in protest, and not one person makes an effort to stop him in his tracks. 
Oh, and of course, because the goalkeeper does a ROLY-POLY to get out of his way. 
Unbelievable.
